columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to determine the exchange rate in one year, in two years, and in five years.

A **purchasing power parity** refers to the thought that the exchange rate adjusts in order to keep a *constant purchasing power* among the currencies. There are **two forms** of PPP, the *absolute* PPP and *relative* PPP.
A **relative purchasing power parity** refers to the concept that there is a *change in exchange rate* that can be determined by the *difference of the inflation rate* of two countries.

The formula to determine the exchange rate based on the relative purchasing power parity is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{$E(S_{t})$} &=\text{$S_{0}$}\times[ 1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}]^t\\\
\end{aligned}$$

wherein: 


$E(S_{t})$ = Expected exchange rate in *t* periods 

$S_{0}$ = Current spot exchange rate  


$h_{FC}$ = Foreign country inflation rate 


$h_{US}$ = Inflation rate in the US

We are given the following data:

- The spot exchange rate for the Hungarian forint is HUF 289.97.
- The inflation rate in the United States will be 2.9% per year.
- The inflation rate in the Hungary will be 4.5% per year.

First, we will determine the exchange rate in one year. Applying the formula of relative purchasing power parity:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{$E(S_{1})$} &=\text{$S_{0}$}\times[ 1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}]^t\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times[ 1+\text{(0.045-0.029)}]^1\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times[ 1+\text{(0.016)}]^1\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times(1.016)^1\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times1.016\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\text{HUF 294.61}}
\end{aligned}$$
 

The exchange rate in one year is **HUF 294.61**.

Next, we will determine the exchange rate in two years. Applying the formula of relative purchasing power parity:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{$E(S_{2})$} &=\text{$S_{0}$}\times[ 1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}]^t\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times[ 1+\text{(0.045-0.029)}]^2\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times[ 1+\text{(0.016)}]^2\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times(1.016)^2\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times1.0323\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\text{HUF 299.34}}
\end{aligned}$$
 

The exchange rate in two years is **HUF 299.34**.

Lastly, we will determine the exchange rate in five years. Applying the formula of relative purchasing power parity:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{$E(S_{5})$} &=\text{$S_{0}$}\times[ 1+\text{($h_{FC}$-$h_{US}$)}]^t\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times[ 1+\text{(0.045-0.029)}]^5\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times[ 1+\text{(0.016)}]^5\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times(1.016)^5\\[10pt]
&=\text{HUF 289.97}\times1.0826\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\text{HUF 313.92}}
\end{aligned}$$
 

The exchange rate in five years is **HUF 313.92**.

As a conclusion,  the exchange rate in one year, in two years, and in five years are **HUF 294.61, HUF 299.34, and HUF 313.92** respectively. The relationship that we used is the **relative purchasing power parity**.
